18 Such variability indeed has implications for control of the pandemic and potential emergence of viral strains with different characteristics, including increased or reduced infectivity and lethality. Although SARS‐CoV‐2 is less lethal than MERS‐CoV, up to 20% of the infected people develop rapidly a severe disease characterized by interstitial pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome that can ultimately lead to death. This is particularly evident in elderly and in people with underlying medical conditions.
